metadata.title: CVE-2021-32142 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.description:
Buffer Overflow vulnerability in LibRaw linux/unix v0.20.0 allows attacker to escalate privileges via the LibRaw_buffer_datastream::gets(char*, int) in /src/libraw/src/libraw_datastream.cpp.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32142` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.20.2-2ubuntu2.22.10.1
libraw20 - 0.20.2-2ubuntu2.22.10.1
No subscription required

notes.note: mdeslaur> This is a stack overflow and is limited to a denial of service on Ubuntu because of compiler hardening features.

criterions.comment: darktable package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.

exactimage package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.

libraw package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.20.2-2ubuntu2.22.10.1').
rawtherapee package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
